metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46884 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: A potential use-after-free vulnerability existed in SVG Images if the Refresh Driver was destroyed at an inopportune time. This could have lead to memory corruption or a potentially exploitable crash. *Note*: This advisory was added on December 13th, 2022 after discovering it was inadvertently left out of the original advisory. The fix was included in the original release of Firefox 106. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 106.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
